manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Sometimes you have to scale down to really clean up. Sometimes, you need a toothbrush armed with bristle tips measuring less than 0.01mm wide, thinner than the average diameter of a human hair strand. That’s where Colgate SlimSoft Charcoal comes in. Its superfine, stylish black charcoal infused bristles removes plaque germs. The bristles clean deep between your teeth and along your gum line, reaching spots that regular bristles cannot reach, and effectively removing germs. Each session with this toothbrush means dark day for germs.

Charcoal infused Bistles remove plaque. Clutter breaking looks Black bristles & black handle. High Bristle Density & Super Slim Tip, “tapered” bristles Specially designed square tufting holes 35% higher density vs regular toothbrushes (more bristles vs. ordinary toothbrushes) 17X Slimmer Tip Bristles, for deeper reach.

Ordinary Bristles Deep cleaning yet gentle Soft and flexible Easy to navigate in the mouth Amazing mouth feel Gently move back & forth in circular strokes at 45° to your teeth Use a brush with a small head & bristles that are gentle on teeth & gums, like Colgate SlimSoft Use a toothpaste that offersA protection from cavities and reduces plaque Brush all tooth surfaces including the inner surface & the chewing surface Dentist recommend to change your toothbrush every 3 months or if it shows wear, even earlier. Do not use a toothbrush with worn out bristles, as it could damage gums

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Toothbrush ------> World Peace???
reviews.reviewText: This is actually my second purchase of these, after buying my first one at, well, what my mother insists my husband, children and I call "The Store That Gramma Says Does Not Exist", (and which we would also refuse to shop at, but with only one paycheck, and in our very small town, we don't actually have the ability to choose not to shop there, and don't unless necessary, I feel compelled to defend my family to nameless strangers, sigh) and, (she goes on breezily) these are seriously fantastic toothbrushes. Seriously. Two years ago I made a serious mistake of purchasing a whitening toothpaste with some kind of polishing beads made by Crest. My mouth reacted to that toothpaste as if it was an allergic reaction, which my mouth never was sensitive to any toothpaste in the past. The whole lining of my mouth was so swollen that it was peeling, I had several ulcers, and the underside of my tongue and gums were all bleeding. A church friend who is a dental hygenist told me that it was the microbeads, and told me to switch to an organic toothpaste, and also to use baking soda sometimes if I needed to, for whitening. Since she, who is a grandmother, has the face of a model, and more importantly here the smile and teeth of a super model, on top of her expertise, I listened, and experimented and finally got the inflammation under control just this past June, with Tea Tree Oil toothpaste with baking soda and this toothbrush combined. This toothbrush is the only one that both makes my mouth feel deeply clean all over, but does not leave my gums bleeding. My husband just went to pick a prescription at a drugstore chain, and a single one of these there was $8, so this pack of three at this price, with the wonderful added bonus of not buying from The Store That Does Exist ( while not living in a Dark Hole in a Jungle in the Rain Forest, and hearing the news of others ) ,makes this a wonderful buy. The bristles are very soft, but strong and very dense at the same time, and hold up to a good scrubbing. The handle is just perfect for my middle aged arthritic hands in the morning and evening when they are at their worst. And the black color with bright colored accents appeals to me as a visually creative person, even seeing it every day the pink color still makes me smile. And with everything going on in the world right now, if a small thing like a toothbrush that is both made so well, feels so great to use, gives such nice results, and has such spirited colors can give you a small smile each day, then what possibly more could you want from your toothbrush? I mean, sadly, it can't bring about World Peace, but more people having small things in their lives that bring them some small joys, that inspires them to give some of that joy away, you know??? And so goes the rambling mind of a 50 year old mom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful slim design
reviews.reviewText: These are soft, work well and the slim design allows you to get into the hard to reach areas. Definitely recommend this item.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and cleans well
reviews.reviewText: I love how these gently clean your teeth and you can clean your gums, tongue and inside cheeks with them and not get any sores.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great brush - sore gums
reviews.reviewText: I just discovered this toothbrush last week (where have I been?) and I must say that I like it a lot! I bought it because I thought the black bristles looked cool, not realizing it was actual charcoal bristles. It is a nice soft brush but not too soft - it doesn't sink all the way to the plastic head when you apply pressure. It fits well in my mouth which isn't giant so that is also a good thing! Here is the reason why it didn't get 5 stars from me (and I may come back to change it) - My gums were so sore on day 2! It felt like I went to the dentist and had an extreme deep cleaning. I had to take Advil because they hurt so bad. I went online and read about the brush and that is when I discovered they were charcoal bristles and that they claimed to give your gums a deep cleaning! They are definitely right! My gums and mouth felt very clean - but I wasn't too happy about the pain. Unless of course this is improving my gum health. I will continue to use it and will rerate it once I have gone to the dentist to see if my gums have in fact gotten better!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tiny bristles are the best!
reviews.reviewText: I don't care about the charcoal feature on these, which seems kind of gimmicky. But the very fine and soft bristles are tremendously good at polishing my teeth to slippery perfection. I prefer the results with this toothbrush to that of fancy electric toothbrushes I've tried. Have been using this toothbrush exclusively for decades.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Though subjective, this particular product is superior than the rest of Colgate's brushes, and even other brands. When it says soft bristles, it means soft bristles. There's only one other brand that I think is better, but it has to be imported and the expense is too great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I always buy extra soft toothbrushes and they're usually $3ish dollars for one, so when I read the reviews on how soft these were and they were 3 for $5, I decided to try them. The bristles are very soft, but they're kind of sharp and irritate my gum line. I feel like they're so soft that I need to brush harder, which I already brush too hard according to my dentist. The handle is also a little flimsy, so it bends a little as I brush (too hard) and since the bristles are so soft, when I brush my tongue, I feel like if I have anything on there, it's just moving it around, not brushing it off. I have invisalign, so I have attachments on my teeth (it's like having the metal regular braces, but it's oddly shaped and tooth colored and only on a few teeth) and they wear my toothbrush out. I usually change brushes on the first day of the month, b/c after brushing over the attachments 2 or 3 times a day for a month, my toothbrush looks like it's been run over by a lawnmower. Well, I have used this one for 3 weeks and it still looks like the day I opened the package, so it definitely holds up well. I will put 1 under my sink as an extra one if someone needs a new one, and the other in my travel bag, but when it's time to replace the one I'm using, I'll stick with the Colgate extra soft.
Don't know if charcoal helps as just started using. But you also need a water flosser.

reviews.reviewTitle: El mejor cepillo que he probado
reviews.reviewText: Son excelentes!!! Buenos para limpiar y muy amables con las encías!!
